Key Arguments: The bill is a dangerous encroachment on freedom of expression.
The terms in the bill are open-ended and grant excessive power to the government.
There is a risk of misuse and abuse of power by the government to suppress alternative views.
The bill favors government-aligned opinions and penalizes dissenting voices.
The government and its institutions are seen as above the law.
The bill is corrupt and should be rejected.
Government power should be limited, and individual freedoms respected.
Notable Quotes: This bill is an extremely dangerous encroachment on the freedom of expression in Australia.
The power will inevitably be misused and abused by governments and their bureaucrats.
The bill is totally corrupt from the start.
The government and its bureaucrats have shown themselves to actually be the dangerous purveyors of misinformation and disinformation.
